HTTPHeadersContent-Type.summary: The Content-Type representation header is used to indicate the original MIME type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).

remarks.para: In responses, a Content-Type header provides the client with the actual content type of the returned content. This header's value may be ignored, for example when browsers perform MIME sniffing; set the X-Content-Type-Options header value to nosniff to prevent this behavior.
In requests, (such as {{HTTPMethod("POST")}} or {{HTTPMethod("PUT")}}), the client tells the server what type of data is actually sent.
